course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: A leader is waiting for "more information" before deciding. What is the risk?
options: Certainty rarely arrives; define the smallest test you could run with what you have
They will make a better decision
No significant risk in this case

questions.question: In this framework, how is "momentum over comfort" defined?
options: Prefer a small step with uncertainty over waiting for certainty; move when you have enough to test
Always act fast regardless of evidence

questions.question: How do you balance momentum and risk?
options: Move when you have enough to test, not when you have zero risk

questions.question: Waiting for perfect information before acting often leads to:
options: Delay and missed learning; you never get perfect information

questions.question: Confusing momentum with recklessness can result in:
options: Acting without any check and repeating avoidable mistakes

questions.question: What should you do with a decision you have been delaying for "more information"?
options: Define the smallest test you could run with what you have; schedule it

questions.question: Why use momentum to learn?
options: Small steps with feedback create learning; waiting for certainty does not
It has no effect on outcomes or learning
